    • Constructor Detail

      • Tunner

        public Tunner(org.terrier.structures.Index index)
        Creates a Tunner object, which is able to fit mu and lambda according to C. Zhai and J. Lafferty Paper
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • tuneMu

        public double tuneMu(double mu,
                     double sampling)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Tunes the mu parameter, used on Dirichlet or DJM Language Model based on the corpus. This is done through Newton's method. Since the method always converges, according to the authors (and it's true, as this is a quadratic function). This method returns mu if either: the modulus of the first derivative is smaller than EPSILON, or the amount of iterations is bigger than MAX_ITERATIONS. Relative difference on the update value is ignored.
        Parameters:
        mu - The initial value of mu. According to the paper authors 1 is a good initial point.
        sampling - The percentage of the corpus vocabulary that is going to be taken in account when tunning mu. This value must be ]0,1[.
        Returns:
        The tuned value of mu.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an I/O fault while reading the index data.
